sentences.sentence: As soon as the girl was left alone, the little man appeared for the third time and said,
“What will you give me if I spin( 纺 ) the straw( 稻草 ) for you this time?”
“I have nothing left to give,” answered the girl.
“Then you must promise me the first child you have after you are Queen,” said the little man.
“But who knows whether that will happen?” thought the girl.
And as she did not see any other way out of her difficulty,
and was far from sure that the King would marry her (for his marriage proposal( 求婚 ) was somewhat lacking in romance( 浪漫 ), even for the period),
she promised the little man what he wanted.
Then he began to spin, until all the straw was gold.
And when in the morning the King came and found all the gold, the wedding( 婚礼 ) was celebrated at once, and the miller’s pretty daughter became a queen.
In a year’s time she brought a fine child into the world.
She had forgotten all about the little man, until one day he came suddenly into her room, and said,
“Now give me what you promised me.”
The Queen was terrified( 非常害怕的 ), and offered the little man all the riches of the kingdom if he would only leave the child.
But the little man said, “No, I would rather have something living than all the treasures of the world.”
Then the Queen began to cry and weep( 流泪 ), so that the little man had pity upon her.
“I will give you three days,” said he, “and if at the end of that time you cannot guess my name, you must give up( 放弃 ) the child to me.”
Then the Queen spent the whole night in thinking about all the names that she had ever heard,
and sent a messenger( 通信员 ) through the land to ask far and wide( 各地 ) for all the names that could be found.
And when the little man came next day she repeated all the names she knew (beginning with Caspar, Melchior, Balthazar), and went through the whole list.
But after each the little man said, “That is not my name.”
The second day the Queen asked all the neighbors what the servants were called, and told the little man all the most unusual names, saying,
“Perhaps you are called Roast-ribs, or Sheepshanks, or Spindleshanks?”
But to each name he replied,
“That is not my name.”
The little man said, “Tomorrow I come for your baby.” and left.
But the Queen followed him quietly so that she could not be seen or heard, up hill and down dale( 山谷 ), until she came to a little house on a high hill.
In front of the house burned a fire, and round the fire danced the funny little man.
He was hopping( 单脚跳 ) up and down on one leg, and singing:
“I spun the Queen’s straw into gold,
and now the Queen’s young child I’ll claim—
For surely no-one can have told her,
Rumpelstiltskin is my name!”
You cannot think how pleased the Queen was to hear that name.
She went back to the palace as swiftly( 迅速地 ) and silently as she had come.
The next day, the little man walked in and said, “Now, Mrs. Queen, what is my name?”
She said at first, “Are you called Jack?”
“No,” answered he.
“Are you called Harry?” she asked again.
“No,” answered he, “now for your last chance.” And then she said,
“This is just a wild guess, but is your name perhaps . . . Rumpelstiltskin?”
“Ah! The devil( 魔鬼 ) told you that! The devil told you that!” cried the little man,
and in his anger he stamped with his right foot so hard that a great crack( 裂缝 ) opened up in the ground in front of him.
Then he stamped with his left foot, and the side of the crack gave way, and he fell down into it and was never seen or heard of again.

article_info.previous: 从前有一个贫穷的磨坊主，他有一个美丽的女儿。一天国王偶然经过注意到女孩漂亮的金发，紧张又贪慕虚荣的磨坊主撒谎说他的女儿可以把稻草变成金子。于是国王带走了女孩并测试她是否真有如此绝技。无助又恐慌的女孩以项链和戒指作为交换，在一个小矮人的帮助下完成了任务，岂料国王竟贪得无厌，已经身无长物的女孩还能顺利渡过这关吗？

question.cn: 小矮人要求女孩儿给他什么？
question.en: What did the little man ask the girl for?

options.en: All of the riches in the kingdom.
All the servants in the palace.

options.cn: 她成为王后以后生的第一个孩子。
options.en: The first child she had after she was Queen.

analysis: 文中提到：“'Then you must promise me the first child you have after you are Queen,’ said the little man.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 王后是怎么得知小矮人的名字的？
question.en: How did the Queen know the little man’s name?

options.cn: 她悄悄地跟踪小矮人偷听到的。
options.en: She followed him quietly and eavesdropped what the little man said.

options.cn: 她逮捕了小矮人威胁他。
options.en: She arrested the little man and threatened him.

analysis: 由原文可知，王后悄悄地跟在小矮人的后面，偷听到小矮人在唱歌：“. . . Rumpelstiltskin is my name!”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 侏儒怪最后发生了什么事？
question.en: What happened to Rumpelstiltskin in the end?

options.en: He was locked away in the prison.

options.cn: 他掉进了一个巨大的裂缝。
options.en: He fell down into a great crack.

analysis: 文中提到：“Then he stamped with his left foot, and the side of the crack gave way, and he fell down into it and was never seen or heard of again.”因此答案选C。
